marketNews.title: Car Sales -5% YoY in March 2025
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that national wholesale car sales in March 2025 fell to 70,909 units (-5.1% YoY, -1.9% MoM), due to a shift in seasonality related to Lebaran and IIMS 2025. The result made wholesale car sales for the first three months of 2025 (3M25) reach 205,136 units (-4.7% YoY), roughly in line with expectations as it represents 23-27% of Gaikindo's 2025 target range of 750,000-900,000 units (vs. 3M24: 25% of the 2024 realization). Highlights of March 2025 car sales: 1. Astra sales weak, although relatively better than other Japanese brands. Combined, the two main Astra International brands (Toyota + Daihatsu) recorded a sales decline (-5.7% YoY, -2.3% MoM) in March 2025, worse than the industry average (-5.1% YoY, -1.9% MoM), causing their combined market share to drop to 50.1% in March 2025 (vs. March 2024: 50.4%, February 2025: 50.3%). The drop was mainly driven by a 21% YoY decline in Daihatsu sales, while Toyota sales grew +6.3% YoY. Cumulatively for 3M25, Toyota + Daihatsu wholesale sales fell -6.9% YoY to 103,954 units, worse than the industry decline (-4.7% YoY), bringing their market share to 50.7% (vs. 3M24: 51.9%). Other Japanese brands weakened significantly in March 2025, with Honda and Suzuki each falling -40.4% YoY and -33.4% YoY respectively. Over 3M25, the two brands fell -20.4% YoY each. 2. Chinese brands continue to surge. BYD recorded sales of 3,205 units in March 2025 (+129% MoM), the highest level since BYD entered Indonesia and surpassing Hyundai sales. This raised BYD's market share to 4.5% in March 2025 (vs. February 2025: 1.9%). Chery posted its highest monthly sales of 1,829 units (+128% YoY, +25% MoM), continuing the trend seen in February 2025. Only Wuling showed a different trend compared to BYD and Chery. Key Takeaway: Combining February and March data to avoid distortion from Lebaran-related seasonality, car sales fell -1.6% YoY. Although weak, the realization is roughly in line with Gaikindo's expectation of stagnant 2025 car sales compared to 2024. The current stagnant market is being supported by the increasing contribution of Chinese brands, which erodes the market share of Japanese brands.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
1. OPEC on Monday (14/4) cut its global oil demand growth forecast to 1.3 million barrels per day for 2025 and 1.28 million barrels per day for 2026, each 150,000 barrels per day lower than the previous projection. This is the first downgrade of oil demand growth since December 2024, driven by the escalation of the trade war due to US tariffs.
2. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Monday (14/4) that the reduction of import income tax (PPh) and customs duties will apply generally, not only to US-origin products. He explained that the adjustment is part of deregulation measures to minimize negative impacts from US reciprocal tariffs. His statement differs from that of the Head of the Fiscal Policy Agency, Febrio Nathan Kacaribu, who said last week that the tax adjustments would apply only to US-origin products.
3. The US government continues its plan to impose import tariffs on semiconductor and pharmaceutical commodities, launching a trade investigation led by the US Department of Commerce on Monday (14/4). The investigation, started on 1 April 2025, focuses on the national security impact of imported semiconductors, semiconductor manufacturing equipment, pharmaceuticals, and finished drug products. Results are expected within 270 days, though US officials have indicated a desire for a faster resolution.
4. Indonesian Minister of Communication and Digital Meutya Hafid said the ministry is opening the possibility to lower frequency fees for telecom operators to improve the health of the telecom business, which requires large capital. The timing of any fee reduction has not been determined as coordination with other ministries and agencies is needed.
5. BPI CIO Pandu Sjahrir announced that a Qatar joint investment fund of USD 4 billion will focus on priority sectors such as food security, energy security, downstream processing, digital infrastructure, health, and tourism.
6. FORE CEO Vico Lomar said the company targets a net profit growth of about +70-80% in 2025. For the first nine months of 2024, FORE posted a net profit of IDR 42 billion (a turnaround from a loss in 9M23), revenue of IDR 727 billion (+135% YoY) and same-store sales growth of +42% YoY. FORE also aims to open 55 new stores in 2025, targeting a total of 300 stores by year-end, and 600 stores within five years.
7. AVIA Deputy CEO Ruslan Tanoko bought approximately 8 million AVIA shares at an average price of IDR 390 per share between 8-10 April 2025, a transaction worth about IDR 3.1 billion. After the transaction, his ownership increased from 0.0609% to 0.0738%.
8. Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada (CMNP) plans a rights issue of roughly 2.2 billion new shares, which could dilute existing shareholders by up to 25%. The issue price has not been announced; proceeds will be used for capital contributions or loans to subsidiaries for toll road construction. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 22 May 2025.
9. Indosat (ISAT) intends to expand its business activities to include, but not limited to, defense-related telecommunications, telecom resale services, AI-based programming, IoT consulting and design, payment system support, advertising, and market research services. The plan will be discussed at the shareholders meeting on 28 May 2025.

tickerNews.title: Stock price movements on Tuesday 15 April 2025
tickerNews.content: On Tuesday (15/4), the stock prices were: ASII down 1.22%, AUTO down 1.95%, and DRMA down 0.55%.

tickerNews.title: TPIA injects capital into PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) together with its business partner Phoenix Power B.V. (a subsidiary of EGCO Group Thailand) deposited capital of IDR 1.75 trillion into PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk by issuing new shares. TPIA contributed IDR 850 billion, while Phoenix Power B.V. contributed IDR 900 billion. After the capital injection, TPIA's ownership in PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk fell from 70% to 66.7%, while Phoenix Power B.V.'s ownership rose from 30% to 33.3%.

tickerNews.title: PANI announces 2025 marketing sales target and project updates
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) management announced in an analyst meeting on Tuesday (15/4) a marketing sales target of IDR 5.3 trillion for 2025 (vs. 2024 realization of IDR 6 trillion, a 12% YoY decline). The target composition is 43% shop-house sales, 36% house sales, and 21% land-plot sales. Meanwhile, Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) targets marketing sales of IDR 2 trillion for 2025 (vs. 2024 realization of IDR 2.1 trillion, a 4% YoY decline), with a composition of 54% shop-house, 34% land-plot, and 12% house sales. PANI estimates that the first 7 km of the Kataraja toll road linking Soekarno-Hatta Airport and PIK 2 can be completed and operational around May-June 2025. Additionally, the MICE building of CBDK, Nusantara International Convention and Exhibition, is expected to operate partially in October 2025 and contribute 10-15% of revenue by 2027.

tickerNews.title: ACES provides 2025 revenue guidance and dividend proposal
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) management, during an earnings call on Tuesday (15/4), gave a revenue growth guidance of +5% YoY for 2025 (vs. 2024 realization of +13% YoY) and a same-store sales growth (SSSG) target of +1% YoY (vs. 2024 realization of +8.8% YoY). ACES plans capex of IDR 250-300 billion in 2025, targeting the opening of about 25-30 new stores. The management also proposed a dividend for fiscal year 2024 with a payout ratio higher than 50% (vs. 2023 payout ratio of 75%), implying a minimum dividend of IDR 26 per share and an estimated dividend yield of 5.3% as of Tuesday (15/4).

tickerNews.title: INTP plans share buyback and share retraction
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) plans to conduct a share buyback with a fund allocation of up to IDR 2.25 trillion from 22 May 2025 to 21 May 2026, without specifying the maximum number of shares to be purchased. Additionally, INTP intends to repurchase a portion of shares issued from the 2021-2024 buyback, not exceeding 165.6 million shares (4.5% of total shares). Both proposals will be discussed at the General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS) and the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 21 May 2025.

tickerNews.title: BNGA announces 2024 dividend
tickerNews.content: Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) plans to distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately IDR 3.9 trillion or IDR 155.73 per share, corresponding to a dividend payout ratio of 57.4%. The cum-date in the regular and negotiation markets is 23 April 2025, with payment scheduled for 14 May 2025. Based on BNGA's closing price on Tuesday (15/4) at IDR 1,825 per share, the implied dividend yield is 8.5%.

tickerNews.title: PWON reports 1Q25 marketing sales
tickerNews.content: Pakuwon Jati (PWON) recorded marketing sales of IDR 330.7 billion in 1Q25 (-14% YoY, -23% QoQ), representing 18.4% of the 2025 target of IDR 1.8 trillion. The largest contribution came from the condominium segment (51%), followed by landed houses (46%) and office space (3%). 59% of 1Q25 marketing sales originated from products subject to VAT DTP.

tickerNews.title: ASRI reports 1Q25 marketing sales
tickerNews.content: Alam Sutera Realty (ASRI) recorded marketing sales of IDR 745.3 billion in 1Q25 (+30% YoY, -13% QoQ), representing 21.3% of the 2025 target of IDR 3.5 trillion. The largest contribution came from the residential segment (60%), driven by sales in the Sutera Rasuna cluster, which accounted for 48% of total residential sales. The remaining marketing sales came from the commercial segment.

tickerNews.title: PTBA supports government downstream projects and studies SNG with PGAS
tickerNews.content: PT Bukit Asam (PTBA) President Director Arsal Ismail said the company will support the government's direction on downstream coal projects, including coal gasification into dimethyl ether (DME) and substitute natural gas (SNG). PTBA will carefully study the DME project, noting that its previous partner, Air Products & Chemicals Inc., withdrew from the project in 2023. PTBA does not want to remain only a supplier for the DME project and aims to be more involved. The SNG project is still in the feasibility study stage together with the state-owned gas company Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS).

tickerNews.title: CMNP plans rights issue of ~2.2 billion new shares
tickerNews.content: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada (CMNP) plans to conduct a rights issue of approximately 2.2 billion new shares, which could dilute existing shareholders by up to 25%. The issue price has not been announced; the proceeds will be used for capital contributions or loans to subsidiaries for toll road construction. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 22 May 2025.

tickerNews.title: FORE targets 70-80% net profit growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: Fore Coffee Indonesia (FORE) aims for a net profit growth of about +70-80% during 2025. In the first nine months of 2024, FORE posted a net profit of IDR 42 billion (a turnaround from a loss in 9M23), revenue of IDR 727 billion (+135% YoY) and same-store sales growth of +42% YoY. FORE also targets opening 55 new stores in 2025, aiming for a total of 300 stores by year-end and 600 stores within five years.

tickerNews.title: AVIA director Ruslan Tanoko purchases ~8 million shares
tickerNews.content: Avia (AVIA) Deputy CEO Ruslan Tanoko bought approximately 8 million AVIA shares at an average price of IDR 390 per share between 8-10 April 2025, a transaction worth about IDR 3.1 billion. After the transaction, his ownership increased from 0.0609% to 0.0738%.

tickerNews.title: ISAT plans expansion into defense telecom and IoT services
tickerNews.content: Indosat (ISAT) plans to add business activities that include, but are not limited to, defense-related telecommunications, telecom resale services, AI-based programming, IoT consulting and design, payment system support, advertising, and market research services. The plan will be discussed at the shareholders meeting on 28 May 2025.
